Hi Christian,

are you using jericho html 2.5 or allready jericho html  2.6 that hasn't 
made it into 1.x yet?
I'm asking cause there seems to be a serious bug in  2.5 that might be 
worsening things.

[1906051] Exponential recursion when non-server tags are present
           inside attribute values during full seq parse (introduced v2.5).


I'm currently not using the jericho html based extractor anymore due to 
the same occasional
OOMEs you seem to be getting, too. The size boundary I had set was 700kB 
with 150ToeThreads.
Most of the time this was working fine - but at least once per week I 
ran into those OOMEs.

The major reason behind the jericho based HTML extractor for me was 
improved form handling -
an experimantal feature I tested that was sending default form 
values/fields. It worked promising
on a small scale - but the risk of getting into serious trouble wasn't 
worth it. (Most shop owners aren't
too happy  about a web crawler endlessly filling shopping carts...)

It might be worth exploring the options of wrinting a new HTML extractor 
- based on some
other HTML parser that works with streams and doesn't require to loader 
the complete document at once.

Regards
  Olaf Freyer

Christian Krumm schrieb:
> Hi,
>
> I have a question concerning the function getContentSize() in the class
> ReplayInputStream. The Java Doc indicates that the function will return
> the total number of content.
>
> So does the function deliver the total number of bytes in the content of
> this Steam?
>
> Background:
> To reduce OOME within the HTML-Parser, I want to only handle files which
> aren't to big. I already exclude non html Documents. But sometimes the
> crawler still gets an OOME and crashes. Adding pause-on-finish doesn't
> seem to help. I can't continue the crawl after an OOME.
> So I plan to only handle files which have content smaller than 30kb.
> Or is this a to big/ small value?
> Perhaps I may also restrict the maximum size of the header to 1kb?
> Any thoughts?
>
>
> Thanks a lot
> Christian
